Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.name: keywordsCache
Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.abstract: The keyword cache. Used to transfer database cache.

Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.name: configure(main:secondary:lang:completion:)
Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.abstract: Method to configure the keyword cache and keyword column of your database. It acts as a setup function.

Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.name: select(contains:key:range:)
Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.abstract: This function acts as a binding between OrionSearch select function and your database one.

Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.name: keywords(keys:record:)
Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.abstract: This function is used to insert the keywords into the keywords column

Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.name: add(records:main:secondary:lang:)
Classes/OSDatabase.html#/s:15SearchKit_S.abstract: Add records to your database while parsing them

Classes/OSDatabase.html.name: OSDatabase
Classes/OSDatabase.html.abstract: OSDatabase is an object that enables OrionSearch to interact with any databases. It also contains a keywords cache that is used for rewriting the query. The cache will be auto-configured with the configure method, but if you already ran this function, you can just restore the cache by initiating the class with it:

Classes/OSQuery.html.name: OSQuery
Classes/OSQuery.html.abstract: OSQuery is an object that represents a search query. It makes the process of parsing and tokenizing a query without the need for user’s interaction. It currently supports 57 languages (ISO 639-1):

Classes/OSRecord.html.name: OSRecord
Classes/OSRecord.html.abstract: OSRecord is an object representing a row in your database. It can be modified to keep certain properties or hide data. It’s a pretty light object that helps OrionSearch unifying its ecosystem architecture without using native objects for better integration across all the different platforms.
